title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Applied Digital Corp Stock

content.text: Applied Digital Corp (formerly known as Applied Digital Solutions Inc.) is incorporated.
Applied Digital Corp completes an initial public offering (IPO) and lists on the NASDAQ stock exchange under the ticker symbol ADSX.
Applied Digital Corp announces a 2-for-1 stock split, effectively doubling the number of shares owned by existing shareholders.
Applied Digital Corp changes its ticker symbol on NASDAQ to ADGL.
Applied Digital Corp implements a 1-for-25 reverse stock split, reducing the number of outstanding shares and increasing the price per share.
Applied Digital Corp undergoes a name change to Digital Angel Corporation.
Digital Angel Corporation completes a 1-for-4 reverse stock split.
Applied Digital Corp (formerly Digital Angel Corporation) changes its name back to Applied Digital Solutions Inc.
